intro: Trisyngyne eymae, commonly known as the Eyma's tristyngyne, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring three stamens and a single pistil. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist forest understories, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are small and greenish-white in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Trisyngyne eymae is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
